Likely because of recent cnages in the way the X server uses the xorg.conf file. I would suggest to install read-edid and then to issue: sudo get-edid| parse-edid               and then use the results for manual entries in your /etc/X11/xorg.conf file under the Configured Video Device area.
It is an application which scans your monitor/crt and extracts it's capabilities

To reiterate. I would suggest to install read-edid and then to issue: sudo get-edid| parse-edid               and then copy and paste from:Section "Monitor"     up to: EndSection             Then replace in your /etc/X11/xorg.conf the Monitor section which currently exists there.
Will require X restart afterwards
